Package edu.rpi.cs.csci4963.su20.dzm.pacman.game

Class Ghost

java.lang.Object
edu.rpi.cs.csci4963.su20.dzm.pacman.game.Ghost
Direct Known Subclasses:
Blinky, Clyde, Inky, Pinky
public abstract class Ghost
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract Ghost super class. Contains most of the ghost logic
Author:
Dylan Ross

  • Field Summary

    Fields

    protected GhostMode curMode
    Current mode of the ghost

    Current position and starting position of the ghost

    Number of ticks to skip between each movement
    protected Point revivePoint
    Middle of board location for ghosts to return to if they are dead

    Current position and starting position of the ghost

  • Constructor Details

    • Ghost

      protected Ghost​(Point curPos, boolean inHouse)
      Initialize a new ghost
      Parameters:
      curPos - the starting position of the ghost
      inHouse - whether or not the ghost is starting inside the ghost house

  • Method Details

    • getTarget

      protected abstract Point getTarget()
      Calculate the ghost's current movement target
      Returns:
      the current target

    • die

      public void die()
      Makes the ghost die and attempt to return to the ghost house in order to revive

    • reset

      public void reset()

    • getIsDead

      public boolean getIsDead()
      Get whether or not the ghost is currently dead
      Returns:
      true if the ghost is dead, false otherwise

    • getPosition

      public Point getPosition()
      Get a copy of the ghost's current position
      Returns:
      a copy of the current position

    • setMode

      public void setMode​(GhostMode newMode)
      Set the ghost's movement mode
      Parameters:
      newMode - the desired value for the new movement mode

    • getMode

      public GhostMode getMode()
      Get the ghost's current movement mode
      Returns:
      the current movement mode

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Should be called every game tick. If enough ticks have gone by for the ghost's speed, then the ghost will move.
